00125 {IDENT} { 
00126     /* We have an identifier--is it a type name or an identifier?
00127        The symbol table will straighten us out... */
00128     yylval->stringVal = new std::string(yytext);

00135 {INT_NUMBER} { 
00136     char *endPtr = NULL;
00137 #ifdef ISPC_IS_WINDOWS
00138     unsigned long val;
00139 #else
00140     unsigned long long val;
00141 #endif
00142 
00143     if (yytext[0] == '0' && yytext[1] == 'b')
00144         val = lParseBinary(yytext+2, *yylloc);
00145     else {
00146 #ifdef ISPC_IS_WINDOWS
00147         val = strtoul(yytext, &endPtr, 0);
00148 #else
00149         val = strtoull(yytext, &endPtr, 0);
00150 #endif
00151     }
00152     yylval->int32Val = (int32_t)val;
00153     if (val != (unsigned int)yylval->int32Val)
00154         Warning(*yylloc, "32-bit integer has insufficient bits to represent value %s (%x %llx)",
00155                 yytext, yylval->int32Val, (unsigned long long)val);
00156     return TOKEN_INT_CONSTANT; 
00157 }

00265 /** Return the integer version of a binary constant from a string.
00266  */
00267 static uint32_t
00268 lParseBinary(const char *ptr, SourcePos pos) {
00269     uint32_t val = 0;
00270     bool warned = false;
00271 
00272     while (*ptr != '\0') {
00273         /* if this hits, the regexp for 0b... constants is broken */
00274         assert(*ptr == '0' || *ptr == '1');
00275 
00276         if ((val & (1<<31)) && warned == false) {
00277             // We're about to shift out a set bit
00278             // FIXME: 64-bit int constants...
00279             Warning(pos, "Can't represent binary constant with 32-bit integer type");
00280             warned = true;
00281         }
00282 
00283         val = (val << 1) | (*ptr == '0' ? 0 : 1);
00284         ++ptr;
00285     }
00286     return val;
00287 }

00290 /** Handle a C-style comment in the source. 
00291  */
00292 static void
00293 lCComment(SourcePos *pos) {
00294     char c, prev = 0;
00295   
00296     while ((c = yyinput()) != 0) {
00297         if (c == '\n') {
00298             pos->last_line++;
00299             pos->last_column = 1;
00300         }
00301         if (c == '/' && prev == '*')
00302             return;
00303         prev = c;
00304     }
00305     Error(*pos, "unterminated comment");
00306 }
00307 
00308 /** Handle a C++-style comment--eat everything up until the end of the line.
00309  */
00310 static void
00311 lCppComment(SourcePos *pos) {
00312     char c;
00313     do {
00314         c = yyinput();
00315     } while (c != 0 && c != '\n');
00316     if (c == '\n') {
00317         pos->last_line++;
00318         pos->last_column = 1;
00319     }
00320 }
00321 
00322 /** Handle a line that starts with a # character; this should be something
00323     left behind by the preprocessor indicating the source file/line
00324     that our current position corresponds to.
00325  */
00326 static void lHandleCppHash(SourcePos *pos) {
00327     char *ptr, *src;
00328 
00329     // Advance past the opening stuff on the line.
00330     assert(yytext[0] == '#');
00331     if (yytext[1] == ' ')
00332         // On Linux/OSX, the preprocessor gives us lines like
00333         // # 1234 "foo.c"
00334         ptr = yytext + 2;
00335     else {
00336         // On windows, cl.exe's preprocessor gives us lines of the form:
00337         // #line 1234 "foo.c"
00338         assert(!strncmp(yytext+1, "line ", 5));
00339         ptr = yytext + 6;
00340     }
00341 
00342     // Now we can set the line number based on the integer in the string
00343     // that ptr is pointing at.
00344     pos->last_line = strtol(ptr, &src, 10) - 1;
00345     pos->last_column = 1;
00346     // Make sure that the character after the integer is a space and that
00347     // then we have open quotes
00348     assert(src != ptr && src[0] == ' ' && src[1] == '"');
00349     src += 2;
00350 
00351     // And the filename is everything up until the closing quotes
00352     std::string filename;
00353     while (*src != '"') {
00354         assert(*src && *src != '\n');
00355         filename.push_back(*src);
00356         ++src;
00357     }
00358     pos->name = strdup(filename.c_str());
00359 }
00360 
00361 
00362 /** Given a pointer to a position in a string, return the character that it
00363     represents, accounting for the escape characters supported in string
00364     constants.  (i.e. given the literal string "\\", return the character
00365     '/').  The return value is the new position in the string and the
00366     decoded character is returned in *pChar.
00367 */
00368 static char *
00369 lEscapeChar(char *str, char *pChar, SourcePos *pos)
00370 {
00371     if (*str != '\\') {
00372         *pChar = *str;
00373     }
00374     else {
00375         char *tail;
00376         ++str;
00377         switch (*str) {
00378         case '\'': *pChar = '\''; break;
00379         case '\"': *pChar = '\"'; break;
00380         case '?':  *pChar = '\?'; break;
00381         case '\\': *pChar = '\\'; break;
00382         case 'a':  *pChar = '\a'; break;
00383         case 'b':  *pChar = '\b'; break;
00384         case 'f':  *pChar = '\f'; break;
00385         case 'n':  *pChar = '\n'; break;
00386         case 'r':  *pChar = '\r'; break;
00387         case 't':  *pChar = '\t'; break;
00388         case 'v':  *pChar = '\v'; break;
00389         // octal constants \012
00390         case '0': case '1': case '2': case '3': case '4':
00391         case '5': case '6': case '7':
00392             *pChar = strtol(str, &tail, 8);
00393             str = tail - 1;
00394             break;
00395         // hexidecimal constant \xff
00396         case 'x':
00397             *pChar = strtol(str, &tail, 16);
00398             str = tail - 1;
00399             break;
00400         default:
00401             Error(*pos, "Bad character escape sequence: '%s'\n.", str);
00402             break;
00403         }
00404     }
00405     ++str;
00406     return str;
00407 }
00408 
00409 
00410 /** Parse a string constant in the source file.  For each character in the
00411     string, handle any escaped characters with lEscapeChar() and keep eating
00412     characters until we come to the closing quote.
00413 */
00414 static void
00415 lStringConst(YYSTYPE *yylval, SourcePos *pos)
00416 {
00417     char *p;
00418     std::string str;
00419     p = strchr(yytext, '"') + 1;
00420     while (*p != '\"') {
00421        char cval;
00422        p = lEscapeChar(p, &cval, pos);
00423        str.push_back(cval);
00424     } 
00425     yylval->stringVal = new std::string(str);
00426 }
